snippet: The Agriculture Department says the expansion of poultry inspections by private companies will modernize an outdated system, but some federal inspectors say the plan puts consumers at risk.
abstract: Agriculture Department proposes expansion of pilot program allowing private companies to take over inspections at poultry plants; says expansion will modernize an outdated system, but some federal inspectors say it increases food contamination risk for consumers.
lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department says the expansion of poultry inspections by private companies will modernize an outdated system, but some federal inspectors say the plan puts consumers at risk.

headline.seo: U.S.D.A. Poultry Inspection Plan Sets Off Dispute
headline.main: Plan to Let Poultry Plants Inspect Birds Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Plan to Let Poultry Plants Inspect Birds Is Criticized
